alert.note: Alert for Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Kittitas Valley; Lower Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest; Northwest Blue Mountains; Simcoe Highlands; Upper Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest; Yakima Valley (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued April 26 at 2:50PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...RISES ON STREAMS AND RIVERS EXPECTED DUE TO SNOWMELT... Streams and rivers emanating from the mountains will see rises the latter half of the week through the weekend into early next week. A ridge of high pressure building over the Pacific Northwest has lead to an increase in temperatures with the trend continuing the remainder of the week into the weekend. Given above normal snowpack currently in place over the mountain areas, accelerating snowmelt is expected to lead to rises in streams and rivers with several gauges forecasted to get close to or meet bankfull over the weekend into early next week. As of now, flooding is not expected. This Hydrologic Outlook will be updated again Thursday afternoon in accordance with the latest updates to the forecast.

area.areaDesc: Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Kittitas Valley; Lower Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest; Northwest Blue Mountains; Simcoe Highlands; Upper Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest; Yakima Valley
